item.title: About Me
item.description:
I am a data analytics engineer by profession based out of Chicago area. My primary interest lies in applying data analytics technologies such as big data and machine learning to financial and banking data to gain business insights and competitive advantage. With over 15 years of extensive software development expertise, I have successfully developed and managed enterprise level projects across multiple industries that includes finance, banking, logistics and telecommunications.

I am a life long learner and have recently completed Data Science Specialization course from John Hopkins University to develop skills in the fast growing field of data analytics. In 2013, I successfully earned coveted Chartered Financial Analyst(CFA) designation after passing all three exams over a period of 4 years. In 2009, I succesfully passed FINRA’s Series 3 exam. Over the years I have completed multiple technical certifications including Java, Service Oriented Architecture and Object Oriented Analysis and Design.

Some of my personal projects in the field of data analytics are published at:

Data Science Projects Using R and Shiny

Data Visualization Projects Using Tableau Public

I can be reached via email dxrodri at gmail.com or via phone 630-447-97SixThree.

item.title: CFA
item.description:
Successfully passed all the three levels of the CFA program.

CFA Certification

item.title: Finance
item.description:
This is the list of courses that I have pursued as part of my professional development in the field of finance.

CFA

  • The Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) credential has become the most respected and recognized investment designation in the world. Learn more about CFA program. The CFA Program is organized into three levels, each culminating in a six-hour exam. The program curriculum progresses in complexity as one move through the three levels:

    • Level I: Focuses on a basic knowledge of the ten topic areas and simple analysis using investment tools
    • Level II: Emphasizes application of investment tools and concepts with a focus on valuation of all types of assets
    • Level III: Focuses on synthesizing all of the concepts and analytical methods in a variety of applications for effective portfolio management and wealth planning

Series 3

  • The Series 3 exam is administered by the Financial Industry Regulatory Athority (FINRA) and covers topics such as options, futures, hedging, margin requirements, and regulations. Learn more about Series 3 certification. The Series 3 exam is broken into two parts:
    • 85 questions on market knowledge
    • 35 questions on regulations

item.title: Data Science Specialization
item.description:
This is the list of courses that I have pursued as part of my professional development in the field of data analytics.

Data Science Specialization

Major Projects

  • Developing Data Projects
    • Mileage predictor App using Regression Models

      • MPG Predictor

This app is developed using Shiny and using regression models, it predicts the mileage of a car using transmission type, number of cyclinders and weight of the car. The source code for the app is available at Github

  • Swiftkey Capstone Project
    • Word Predictor App using Text Mining techniques

      • Word Predictor

This app is developed using Shiny and predicts the next word the user is likely to type by using tm and qdap packages. The app is hosted on Shiny website. The source code for the app is available at Github

Presentations (using rpubs and slidify)

  • Swiftkey Capstone Project
    • Presentation using RPres

Assignments

Click on the following clicks to view the assignments (developed using R) submitted as part of this course.

  • Data Scientists Toolbox
  • R Programming
  • Getting And Cleaning Data
  • Exploratory Data Analysis
  • Statistical Research
  • Reproducible Research
  • Statistical Research
  • Developing Data Products
  • Machine Learning
  • Regression Models
  • Swiftkey Capstone Project

Grades


  • Data Science Specialization

  • Data Scientists Toolbox - Grade Achieved: 98%
  • R Programming - Grade Achieved: 100%
  • Getting And Cleaning Data - Grade Achieved: 84%
  • Exploratory Data Analysis - Grade Achieved: 75%
  • Reproducible Research - Grade Achieved: 98%
  • Statistical Research - Grade Achieved: 92.8%
  • Regression Models - Grade Achieved: 100%
  • Machine Learning - Grade Achieved: 100%
  • Developing Data Products - Grade Achieved: 99.7%
  • Swiftkey Capstone Project
